facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 1369 of 1966 filed in Supreme Court.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No. 1369 of 1966.

facts.text: Appeal by special leave from judgment and order dated September 11, 1962 of Allahabad High Court in Civil Revision No. 653 of 1959.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated September 11, 1962 of the Allahabad High Court in Civil Revision No. 653 of 1959.

facts.text: Appellant, 1st respondent and Sukh Lal executed arbitration agreement on September 9, 1955 referring disputes to five arbitrators.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant, the 1st respondent and one Sukh Lal who died during the pendency of these proceedings referred their disputes to five arbitrators as per the written agreement executed by them on September 9, 1955.

facts.text: Sukh Lal died during pendency of proceedings.

anchor.surface_text: the 1st respondent and one Sukh Lal who died during the pendency of these proceedings referred their disputes

facts.text: Arbitrators made award on October 11, 1955.

anchor.surface_text: Arbitrators made their award on October 11, 1955.

facts.text: Arbitrators duly served notice of making and signing award on parties.

anchor.surface_text: They duly served on the parties to the arbitration agreement, numberice of making and significant award.

facts.text: Award was registered.

anchor.surface_text: The award was thereafter registered.

facts.text: Appellant filed suit on November 1, 1955 in court of Munsiff Hawali Meerut to make award rule of court and pass decree.

anchor.surface_text: On November 1, 1955 the appellant filed a suit in the companyrt of Munsiff Hawali Meerut praying that the award in question be made a rule of the companyrt and decree passed in accordance with the same.

facts.text: Notice in suit could not be personally served on defendants as they refused; process server reported on 19-11-1955.

anchor.surface_text: It is said that the numberice taken in that suit companyld number be personally served on the defendants as they refused to accept the same. That fact was reported to the companyrt by the process server as per his report dated 19-11-1955.

facts.text: Defendants filed written statement on February 3, 1956 challenging award.

anchor.surface_text: Thereafter the defendants filed their written statement on February 3, 1956 wherein they challenged validity of the award on various grounds.

facts.text: Defendants contended award vitiated by arbitrators' misconduct in using personal knowledge.

anchor.surface_text: They companytended that the award was vitiated because of misconduct on the part of the arbitrators inasmuch as the arbitrators decided the disputes referred to them primarily on the basis of their personal knowedge.

facts.text: Defendants contended arbitration agreement obtained by undue influence.

anchor.surface_text: They also companytended that the arbitration agreement was obtained from them by exercise of undue influence.

facts.text: Defendants contended subject matter could not be referred to arbitration under U.P. Act 1 of 1951.

anchor.surface_text: Their further companytention was that the subject matter of the dispute companyld number under law be referred to, arbitration in view of the provisions of U.P. Act 1 of 1951.

facts.text: Defendants contended suit was barred by time.

anchor.surface_text: It was also companytended by them that the suit was barred by time.

facts.text: Trial court accepted defendants' contention of arbitrators' misconduct.

anchor.surface_text: The trial companyrt accepted the companytention of the defendants that the arbitrators were guilty of misconduct.

facts.text: Trial court held arbitration agreement executed by free will, plea of undue influence not made out.

anchor.surface_text: Dealing with the issue of undue influence, it came to the companyclusion that the arbitration agreement was number executed by the defendants according to their free will. But it held that the plea of undue influence was number made out.

facts.text: Trial court upheld that subject matter could not be referred to arbitration under U.P. Act 1 of 1951.

anchor.surface_text: It upheld the companytention of the defendants that the subject matter of the dispute companyld number have been referred to arbitration in view of the provisions of U.P. Act I of 1951.

facts.text: Civil Judge in appeal reversed trial court decree.

anchor.surface_text: In appeal the learned Civil Judge reversed the decree of the trial companyrt.

facts.text: Appellate court agreed arbitrators used personal knowledge but held permitted by agreement.

anchor.surface_text: While agreeing with the trial companyrt that the arbitrators had used their personal knowledge in deciding the disputes referred to them, that companyrt held that under the terms of the agreement, it was open to the arbitrators to decide the disputes in question on the basis of their personal knowledge.

facts.text: High Court in revision reversed appellate court on all points.

anchor.surface_text: The High Court in revision differed from the appellate companyrt on all the points mentioned above.

facts.text: High Court held arbitrators guilty of misconduct for using personal knowledge without specific empowerment.

anchor.surface_text: It came to the companyclusion that the arbitration agreement did number specifically empower the arbitrators to decide the disputes referred to them on the basis of their personal knowledge they having utilized their personal knowledge in deciding the disputes, they were guilty of legal misconduct and companysequently the award made by them is vitiated.

facts.text: High Court held disputes could not be referred to arbitration under U.P. Act 1 of 1951.

anchor.surface_text: It also came to the companyclusion that the disputes in question companyld number have been referred to arbitration in view of the provisions of U.P. Act 1 of 1951.

facts.text: Arbitrators stated in award they decided based on personal knowledge.

anchor.surface_text: In fact the award says We gave our companysideration to the entire dispute which is in full knowledge of us, the panchas.

facts.text: No notice of filing of award served on defendants.

anchor.surface_text: There is absolutely numberproof in this case that a numberice of the filing of the award into companyrt had ever been given to the defendants.

facts.text: Suit not barred by time contention not pressed.
